caption:
This photograph captures a bustling scene in an urban parking lot filled with various cars from the 1970s. The image presents a vibrant mix of colors and activity, characterized by both the vehicles and the people interspersed among them.

At the forefront of the shot is a maroon car (possibly a vintage Ford), with a young boy sitting on its trunk. He seems to be eating or drinking something while appearing deep in thought. Other vehicles visible include a bright yellow car packed with passengers peering out and several other sedans and haulers of various colors like red, white, and tan.

Behind the maroon car where the boy is seated, a group of adults and children are engaged in some kind of interaction. One man, possibly a father, holds a toddler while talking to another adult holding a large map, suggesting they might be tourists or travelers trying to find their way. A woman in a red skirt seems to be talking with another child standing on the ground next to her.

The environment around the vehicles is a grey, likely concrete, parking lot marked with white parking lines, indicating a well-organized urban area. The sky is overcast, lending a slightly gloomy atmosphere to the scene, which contrasts with the vivid colors of the cars and the clothing of the people. 

Overall, the photo depicts a moment of travel or a transient stop for these groups, highlighting a slice of life from a past era through its depiction of vintage cars and fashion.
title: People and vehicles waiting for the ferry at the Bainbridge Island Washington State Ferry Terminal. Increased ferry and road traffic is expected when the Navy's Trident submarine base is built nearby. A "new city" is proposed to house a substantial portion of the projected 27,000 people who will move into the area when the naval installation is completed.
